column4: to share files and folders in Windows XP, you can right-click what you want to share, select sharing, type a description and a password, and you're set. In Ubuntu, it seems necessary to read books in order to accomplish the same thing.. How is this possible?
Nah, it's actually pretty easy. Let me walk you through the process. (2 steps, I think)
first, go to System -> Administration -> Shared Folders
It might tell you that support for shared folders isn't installed. Let it install the packages for you.
And you've added the folders you want to share to the list in shared folders?
In that case, it sounds like something is wrong. That same procedure works fine for me.
you left out configuring /etc/samba/smb.conf. Since the default is to not allow that kind of sharing, it's necessary.
Hmm, I don't remember having to mess with Samba's configuration to get it to work.
Perhaps you do need to read a book to get it working, then. :-(
you've got that right. It should just work, the way Windows users are used to.
do you know how to make a password protected share with security = share?
as I understand it, it can't be installed on xp home since it requires sfu?
Hmm, don't know. Is there not a free software replacement?
